subject: Critical Thinking
subcategory: Evidence & Truth: How We Know What's Real
title: Statistical Significance vs. Practical Significance
description: A quick win: understand Statistical Significance vs. Practical Significance.

hook.text: A study finds that a drug reduces blood pressure by 0.5 mmHg. Statistically significant. Clinically meaningless.

buildup.text: Statistical significance means the result is unlikely due to chance. It says nothing about the size of the effect.

discovery.text: Practical significance asks: is the effect large enough to matter in the real world?

twist.text: With 10 million participants, even trivial differences become 'significant.' The p-value is a function of sample size.

climax.text: Always ask two questions: 'Is it statistically significant?' AND 'Is the effect large enough to matter?'

punchline.text: Significant doesn't mean important. Read the effect size.

quiz.question: What does statistical significance (p < 0.05) actually tell us?
options: The result is unlikely due to chance alone
The effect is large enough to matter
